mutualConnectionsText: 1 mutual connection: James Van, M. A., CDF (he/him)

description:
I'm a data science manager at Quora. I manage a team of six data scientists supporting our work in content moderation, user growth, mobile, content creation and user relationships, creator growth, international community development, product operations, and the acceleration of product development. I lead the continued development of our experiment analysis platform, and I have filled in to lead product development in mobile and user growth.

Previously I was a computational condensed matter physicist.
jobDescription:
• I manage a team of six scientists covering eight areas: content moderation, user growth, mobile, content creation and user relationships, creator growth, international community development, product operations, and the acceleration of product development.
• I lead the process for improving our experiment analysis platform and other tools for analyzing experiments.
• I led a team of data scientists that developed a model to forecasts Quora's growth.
• I continue to make individual contributions, including improving our experimentation analysis platform and continuing to specialize in high-priority metrics investigations.
• I filled in to lead product development in mobile and user growth during those team's lead's parental leaves.
jobDescription2:
• I led and mentored three data scientists in two product teams focusing on product mechanics and internationalization.
• I managed three summer interns.
• I led technical projects.
• I continued to make individual contributions to product development as a member of cross-functional project teams.

description:
I am interested in modern data algorithms, data flow, and applications. I am particularly interested in datasets around human behavior, such as social and information networks.

I am also passionate about Scala and it's potential as a data science tool. I spearheaded the release of Wisp, a repl-focused plotting utility for scala: https://github.com/quantifind/wisp
jobDescription:
Hello!

Plaid sits at the epicenter of a fintech explosion and is helping to govern the next generation of financial apps. 

I focus on Data Engineering, helping connect maintain and develop data pipelines across Mongo/MySQL/Redshift, S3, Airflow, Spark, Golang, ... you get the idea. We're working with incredibly interesting data at impactful sizes.

I love working with my coworkers. The team is excited & enthusiastic, mature & compassionate. I would love to chat further if you have questions about Plaid - reach out!

All the best,
Austin
jobDescription2:
Periscope Data is all about speed - you should move at the same speed you can think, not be bottlenecked by your tools. Searching, analyzing, and sharing your data are all super fast in Periscope. 

I joined Periscope to learn about explosive growth - how to scale a team, a product, and a company while they all continue to accelerate. I am super proud of how we tackle problems, drive projects, iterate quickly, and get great feedback from our customers. 

I came in not knowing any of the tech stack. On my second day I shipped a SQL autocompleter. In my first week I wrote a SQL formatter. In my first month I helped re-write our entire data processing engine. I touched all parts of the product and architecture, helped define our roadmap, and even served a stint as Editor-in-Chief of the Periscope Blog.

Periscope is an amazing company built by amazing coworkers. If you're looking to get an touch with an alumn, don't hesitate to reach out.

description:
I turn data science into actionable business results. I'm all about making a difference to the business in the short term (six months or less). Data quality input and output issues? I know how to find & fix them. Insight into business performance? I've done that. Insight for customers to win business? That's what I do. 
I'm a VP with rock-solid data science team-building experience, a powerful data science background, and experience that cuts across the entire business. My breadth of knowledge is unique.
Check out my blog: https://blog.engora.com/
jobDescription:
I apply data science to the data of the business for short-term business benefits. This includes:
* Analysis of cybersecurity data to produce detailed marketing content. For example, examining the cybersecurity of the oil and gas pipeline industry and comparing it to the S&P 500. 
* Analysis of the sales funnel using data science to improve the process.
* Data quality, consistency, and reporting.
* Legal and regulatory work.
I'm building a team and recruiting data scientists.
jobDescription2:
MANAGEMENT & LEADERSHIP. I built a team of 11 data scientists from the ground up, including hires in the US and Europe. I ensure the analysts and scientists who work for me develop their careers through ongoing training and coaching. My data science team has won more company awards per head than any other team.

TECHNICAL. I'm hands-on with the full data science stack: SQL, AWS, GCP, PySpark, Pandas, Bokeh, NumPy, SciPy, Databricks, Git, Qubole, etc. 

DATA QUALITY. Huge data sets are noisy and dirty. Several analysts in my group are focused on different aspects of data quality (in and out) – we fix the hard problems. 

STATISTICS. Poisson, lognormal, binomial, significance, p-values, power, z-test, … I've used it all. I know A/B tests and I know alternatives like difference-in-difference.

SELLING. My data science team uses analytics to demonstrate value to accounts at the time of sale and on an on-going basis. When I recruit, I’m careful to select people who can talk to customers and talk to non-technical people. My analysts and data scientists work hand-in-glove with sales and customer success.

LEGAL. I’m very familiar with the GDPR and US law (state and federal) and I know what it takes to be privacy compliant. I have sideline expertise in contract law.

STRATEGY. I decide what my data scientists will do and when they will do it. We work for the bigger picture.

COMMUNICATIONS. Unusually for a technical person, I love public speaking, even more unusually, I’m very good at it. I can also write.

Reporting to Chief Analytics Officer.

jobDescription2:
These are a few Data Science Projects I have built recently. 
Please visit respective GitHub Links to view the actual code and analysis.

(i) Predictive Model for Seizure Detection in Epileptic Patients| PCA | XGBOOST | Randomized Grid Search
•	Developed a very effective XG Boost model on the high dimensional brain activity record (EEG) data for epileptic patients. Devised a robust approach to handle the computational challenges because of dimensionality of data. Performed PCA followed by several baseline model to spearhead the right approach.
•	Eventually employed Randomized Grid Search to get optimal hyperparameters which delivered an accuracy of 97% which was critically higher than baseline model. Further, the Random Grid search cut down the computational time by 50%.

(ii) Future Sales Prediction of a Grocery Store | XGBoost | ANN | Ensemble Modeling
•	Built an ensemble of XG Boost and ANN model to get the optimal performance score for predicting the sales volume. Deftly handled extremely large volume of data (1 billion rows) by building the base model on random sample of a smaller fraction and then built the final model with optimal hyperparameters on whole dataset.

description:
I use data to answer questions about how people feel and act in a digital context. 

SKILLS SUMMARY
 
Software & coding:
R, SQL, Python, git
Visualization, reporting, notebooks and Rmarkdown

Research methods & statistics:
Statistical modeling, e.g., regression, correlation, descriptive statistics
Psychometrics & measure validation
Statistical inference, research design and experimentation (i.e., A/B testing)
Robustness & reproducibility: Bayesian analyses, power analysis, data simulation

Currently, I'm a Data Scientist at GitHub, where I research developer productivity.

My award-winning research offers insights on topics like well-being, social cognition, and behavioral intentions. ​My research has been recognized by dissertation awards, international fellowships, and data science scholarships from RStudio::conf, Datacamp, and Open Data Science Conference. As a consultant with the research organization Project Implicit, I deliver workshops to businesses, educators, and governmental organizations on the science of social biases.

Read more at lizredford.weebly.com.

headline: Data Science & Engineering at Netflix
jobTitle: Senior Data Engineer - Data Science & Engineering
allSkills: Data Warehousing, ETL, Business Intelligence, Master Data Management, SOA, Hadoop, MySQL, Oracle, Informatica, Perl, Python, mongodb, PHP, Amazon Web Services, DB2, Websphere, elasticsearch, Teradata, Dimensional Modeling, redis, Greenplum, OLTP, Datastage, Sphinx, ab initio
description:
Deep data management experience across a wide breadth of domains, technologies, platforms, and architectural patterns.  Most recent experience includes senior-level, individual contributor Data Engineering roles at the intersection of the following:

Domains
* Studio Production  
* Cloud Infrastructure (Capacity and Efficiency) 
* Information Security 
* Payments 
* Machine Learning and Analytics 

Languages/Technologies
* Java, Scala, Python, R  
* Git, Gradle, Jenkins, Spinnaker (CI/CD) 
* Cassandra, Elasticsearch, Druid, JanusGraph, Tableau 

Platforms/Frameworks
* Spark, Hadoop, Mesos 
* AWS (EC2, EBS, RDS, S3, SNS/SQS, DynamoDB, etc.) 
* Spring Boot

Patterns
* Dimensional data warehousing, Master Data Management 
* Distributed data processing/Batch & Stream-based ETL 
* Microservices, REST API development (Spring Boot)
jobDescription:
Designing & building scalable data products in support of various operational and analytic initiatives.  Highlights include:

* Developed a cross-platform utility that enables use of t-digest (https://github.com/tdunning/t-digest) approximate histograms in Spark, Hive, and Druid queries, supporting interoperability between probabilistic sketches created via different versions of the t-digest library. 

* Contributed to Kayenta (https://github.com/spinnaker/kayenta) OSS Automated Canary Analysis tool, porting the Mann-Whitney U Test algorithm to Scala. 

* Developed a Spark-based ETL framework - a library of reusable components solving for common ETL development patterns.  Used by data engineers & non-data engineers alike, enabling rapid development and self-service data sourcing. 

* Designed & built a graph (network) based Master Data Management system for maintaining a universal system of record for cloud infrastructure primitives (clusters, instances. etc.) and allowing for federated data governance of corresponding metadata. 

* Developed the data processing & ML anomaly detection layer of a Security Information and Event Management system. 

* Developed various time series-based anomaly detection pipelines in support of Payments fraud detection and processing optimization efforts. 

* Developed, maintained, and supported numerous distributed (Spark, Pig) ETL pipelines, encompassing extremely large data volumes (e.g., high 10’s of billions of rows per hour) and complex processing logic (e.g., high-volume distributed lookups against extremely large, dynamic datasets.)

* Prototyped a distributed deep learning training architecture for computer vision models, utilizing Horovod on Spark 3.x and a GPU-enabled cluster.  Enabled end-to-end distributed processing from feature engineering through model training.
jobDescription2:
* Designed, built and managed LikeList data and search platforms. 

* Developed underlying site database. 

* Modeled dimensional analytical data mart and built out reports. 

* Utilized MapReduce on Hadoop to perform ad hoc analysis on voluminous unstructured data. 

* Created roadmap for scale-out of data systems, accounting for web-scale social growth patterns and addressing transactional, operational, and analytic capability requirements. 

* Advocated for, planned & managed deployment of data environments in the Cloud, namely Amazon Web Services EC2, EBS, RDS, EMR, and S3 offerings.

jobDescription:
Client - Top 5 health insurance provider, Team - Fraud, Waste, and Abuse 

• Generated 25 hypotheses, 29 member, and 51 pharmacy features in PySpark using multiple data sources such as Rx and medical claims, drug, pharmacy, member-char, etc.
•  Reduced existing features from 15990 to 1781 features using 10 customized feature selection steps and used univariate analysis to reduce the features
•  Detected multicollinearity with Variance Inflation Factor and applied dimensionality reduction technique like PCA to get the total 248 principal components which explain a minimum of 85% of the variance for all the dimensions such as Rx, mbr-char, clinical codes, procedure codes, diagnostic codes, etc to get the representation from each category 
•  Built a production-level Bisecting K-means clustering algorithm in PySpark on 40M members and 248 principal components to get the optimal number of homogeneous set of member clusters and evaluated clustering results by computing Silhouette score metric
•  Interpreted and understood the cluster results and profiled the member clusters to identify the patterns in Rx claims
•  Collaborated with the client, cross-functional, and offshore India team to understand and gather the requirements and delivered the project efficiently

Client - Top 3 telecom service provider, Team - Marketing, Strategy, and Planning 

• Built data pipeline to integrate data from different sources to analyze monthly recurring charges of Wi-Fi users and generated Tableau dashboards for the marketing team to visualize the data for further analysis
• Created a report and analyzed the top ten offers to its customers on weekly basis across the US. Also, performed the complex tableau calculations like three/six-month survivability rate which helped to acquire more customers by 12%

-Yum is a recipe app where you can search for recipes, add recipes to your recipe box, and automatically add the recipe ingredients to your shopping list with the aisles the recipes can be found in. Once you have tried the recipe, you can review the recipe and post pictures of what you made.
-Technologies Used: HTML, CSS, Python, Django, PostgreSQL, AWS S3 Buckets

OnlyPages
- A group project where we build a coupled app using MongoDB, Express.js, React, and Node.js to give the user a social media experience around books. Users can review books, add to their different collections, and post about their book-related topic of choice
- Technologies Used: HTML, CSS, Javascript, MongoDB, Mongoose, Node.js, Express.js, React

Nagging-Media
- Nagging-Media is a social media clone where you can post, like, and comment on friends’ posts. The site allows you to add categories to your posts and see posts based on categories. The site also has chatroom functionality.
- Technologies Used: HTML, CSS, Javascript, MongoDB, Mongoose, Node.js, Express.js, Socket.io

Retro Snake Game
- Built two versions of snake game for the browser using vanilla JS and basic HTML and CSS and one in Python that used pygame and numpy. There was a heavy emphasis on OOP when creating this small app.
- Technologies Used: HTML, CSS, Javascript, Python

jobDescription:
• Managing data analytics efforts to research, remediate, and prevent IRS undelivered mail - and identify opportunities for improvement. Building regression models to predict the probability of a recent address change to improve IRS resource allocation decisions when sending notices in the mail.
• Uplift regression modeling to help the Automated Collection System (ACS) select more productive cases to assign treatment (receiving a notice) to improve business outcomes based on key metrics, such as total dollars collected.
jobDescription2:

• Built functionalized scripts and pipelines in Python and SQL to automate querying, cleaning, transformation, loading, analysis, and visualization of data from Big Data relational databases containing billions of records – for consistent and reliable analytics reporting as well as data prep for model training and evaluation. 
• Business management consulting to IRS to develop strategic plans to improve the process of generating notice correspondence – as well as a plan for the prioritization and phasing of redesigning hundreds of notice types. Designing and delivering presentations often on tight deadlines.
• Task management for several projects to plan and monitor task progress against backlogs of major tasks and milestones.
• Rigorous 1 month company-sponsored data science training to predict transaction fraud. Coded a functionalized end-to-end pipeline to read in, clean, join, and transform millions of observations to pass through the selected anomaly detection model and generate predictions.

description:
Who I Am

I am a scientist, a mathematician, and a programmer. Together, these traits make me a problem solver and a data scientist. I graduated with degrees in kinesiology and data science; two domains which reflect my passionate curiosity and commitment to optimize. I am driven by data science and the power it holds at solving problems and making better decisions. I am independent and can work on my own and take initiative when needed. Having grown up playing team sports, I am also a team player and thrive in groups that move towards a similar goal. I have strong business acumen and can communicate effectively to peers, superiors and stakeholders.

Experience

As an Assistant Instructor for Applied Machine Learning, I helped drive projects like risk management and object detection while also reinforcing foundations of machine learning to other students. As a Data Analyst, I created and refactored corporate reporting dashboard including profit and loss statements and operation expenses. I implemented data models that lowered the cardinality of data by millions of rows improving efficiency and the ability to bring more historical information.

What I Do

I learn techniques and algorithms for machine learning and apply them to solve business problems. For example, I build data transformation pipelines using Python and SQL, processing millions of rows of data which I feed into machine learning models like gradient boosted trees or neural networks. I understand the abstractions of these models, why they are useful, how they can be applied, what parameters are needed, and the positives/negatives or tradeoffs as compared to other models used to solve similar problems. 

The bottom line: I optimize, make predictions, and generate strategic insights for business or research.

description: I am a senior double majoring in Computer Engineering and Biomedical Engineering with minors in Math and Chemistry. I have solid experience working at two engineering internships, Abbvie and Epic. I have also worked in multiple research and volunteer settings. I have maintained a 3.51 GPA over 191 credit hours in mostly engineering/ technical coursework. Im am interested have project experience in the field of machine learning and data analysis.
jobDescription2: In the fall of 2017 I began my senior design project, list below as CadaVR, in conjunction with the Heath Care Enginnering Systems Center. This project was over the course of two semesters and we produced a virtual reality environment in unity that allows medical students to interact with and study 3D models generated from CT and MRI data. After working with the VR Lab for a year I was asked to return for my final year of school and work on implementing other VR solutions for medical education. I am now developing a pipeline process to take 2-D DICOM images for either CT or MRI data, generate 3D models with segmentation, then use this 3D model in an ultrasound simulation. The simulated ultrasound signal will be generated in unity and paired with haptic feedback devices for first training medical students in how to use an ultrasound, and then for training them on how to use an ultrasound to locate a breast tumor and perform a needle based biopsy. The training environment will then be ported to virtual reality to give a truly immersive training experience. The final deliverable will be a software that allows a student to arbitrarily input real patient data and then practice using an ultrasound to diagnose and treat certain diseases.

description:
As Director of Data Science at Invoca, I lead teams that deliver groundbreaking AI powered software features for the Invoca platform. As per Forrester (Invoca as a Leader in The Forrester Wave™: Conversation Intelligence: Sales And Marketing, Q4 2021 report): “Invoca is one of the few established conversation intelligence vendors that can legitimately claim AI capabilities.”

Phone calls and related conversational mediums are a sophisticated problem domain - most standard machine learning techniques just don't hold up against it. Our depth in sophisticated Bayesian techniques has enabled us to build state of the art proprietary technology that excels at conversational analytics. As a result, our customers have insights into the inbound conversations to their businesses that would otherwise not be possible.
jobDescription:
As Director of Data Science at Invoca, I lead our AI and ML based initiatives. I am lucky enough to work with an incredible team of developers and data scientists. We're been honored to have our industry-leading Signal AI product be recognized by numerous awards and coverage, including:

* CB Insights AI Top 100 
* AI Breakthrough Awards Top 100
* Forrester New Wave : AI-Fueled Speech Analytics Solutions

Details of those awards: https://blog.invoca.com/invoca-wins-ai-breakthrough-award-for-signal-ai-solution/

Key Accomplishments:
* Co-Inventor on Patents #9,961,198, #9,699,309, #9167078, #10269376, #10332546, and others

* Creation and management of the Invoca data science team
* Leading Signal AI development

About Invoca:

Invoca helps the modern marketer drive inbound calls and turn them into sales. By bringing call intelligence to marketers and their existing marketing technology systems, Invoca’s platform delivers the visibility required to engage mobile customers beyond the click. Invoca has powered more than $5 billion in sales for its customers and is backed by Salesforce Ventures, Accel Partners, Upfront Ventures and Rincon Venture Partners. For more information, please visit www.invoca.com.

Building on my work with neural networks at Intel labs and previous recommender engine experience, I was the software architect and dev lead on our Signal AI feature. description:
I'm a Full-Stack Data Scientist with a background in speech processing and finance. I work best in product verticals,  where I can expand and experiment on product proposals, set up data infrastructure, build models, and make sure that the outcome of my work is deployed and used. 

---
Leadership Experience:
I've worked, led, and mentored Data Engineers, Software Engineers, and Data Scientists. You can read more about my philosophy on managing a data science team effectively: https://medium.com/swlh/how-to-foster-a-culture-of-empathy-within-your-data-team-2f0083e74962

---
Technical Experience

This is a brief summary of the languages, frameworks, and patterns I've worked with. I do not consider myself an expert in any of these, nonetheless, I've used about 80% of the below in production settings, often being an early adopter on the team. 

▪ Languages: Python, R, and Scala (i.e., Spark).
▪ Databases: On OLAP side, I know Redshift very well (both as a user and as an administrator), but also worked with BigQuery and Snowflake. For microservice backends, I use PostgreSQL. 
▪ CI/CD: Jenkins, Artifactory, Coveralls, Github Actions
▪ Orchestration frameworks: DBT, Dagster (i.e., an alternative to Airflow)
▪ Infrastructure: AWS (S3, EC2, IAM, Sagemaker, RDS, Redshift, DMS). I know how to interact with infrastructure using Boto and Terraform. I'm also a big fan of Tilt for local Kubernetes development.
▪ Machine Learning: I have very a good foundation on loss functions and optimization functions. On the supervised modeling side, I use Random Forests or GBM. For unsupervised modeling, the techniques I use most often are isolation forests and DBSCAN.
▪ Statistics: Bootstrap techniques and permutation-based techniques. Good familiarity with linear mixed-effects modeling, link functions, how to design A/B tests, and how to monitor experimental results.
▪ Frameworks: On a daily/weekly basis, I use the following: pandas, numpy, scipy, sklearn, keras, lightgbm, poetry, pytest, hypothesis, pydantic, fastapi, sqlalchemy, alembic.
jobDescription2:
• Core data scientist on the team building machine learning services that support Earnest underwriting infrastructure.
• Daily experience with microservice development, databases, unit tests, cloud deployment, CI/CD.
* Developed a Python microservice template. This template allows a person on the team to easily build and deploy Python microservices. It comes with ORM, logging, dependency management, and a variety of automation utilities that enable rapid model deployment. 
* Researched, built and deployed an income service model. This model outperformed several 3rd party top tier providers and supports 50% automation in underwriter decision making.
* Researched, built and deployed several models that support our Student Loan Origination product. 
* Researched and built a customer acquisition model that led to a 40% reduction in direct mail marketing costs and outperformed several third-party providers, such as Epic and LendingScience. 
* Wrote a Python microservice that supports dynamic pricing and scoring. It currently is used to score and price $20billion/year student loan volume.
* Supervised the work of 3-4 direct reports (mix of Data Engineers and SWE) by scoping out project requirements, performing sprint reviews, retrospectives, postmortems, and code reviews
* Exposed data from over a dozen microservices in Redshift. Set up the tone for data governance and data documentation. Maintained and optimized the data warehouse.
schoolDescription: I finished my PhD in Cognitive and Brain Sciences, which is to say that I studied how human brains process and understand information. During my PhD years, I focused on finding out how listeners process accented speech, how they integrate visual and spoken information, how they learn the meaning of new words, how to more sparsely represent the structure of language, and how working memory affects the way we process the world around us. My graduate career has given me a ton of experience in running behavioral studies, asking relevant research questions, and statistics.

• Managed a team of eight composed of data scientists, data analysts, and machine learning engineers while also collaborating with sales, marketing, and IT.

schoolDescription: • Graduated with Distinction• Analyzed bond liquidity in Hadoop by running queries in both Pig and Hive to understand the impact that the financial crisis had on bond liquidity. Further, through Hadoop Streaming, developed a custom MapReduce code to calculate bond liquidity.• Conducted text analysis and natural language processing on Amazon reviews to extract sentiment towards product features. This included building several classification models (Decision Trees, Multinomial Naïve Bayes, and Support Vector Machines) to classify positive or negative reviews based on unigrams, bigrams, and noun phrases of the review corpus along with applying several term weights such as TFiDF and Mutual Information. Also, I applied Word2Vect algorithm on text review corpus for a product and then clustered the term vectors using Affinity Propagation and Fuzzy clustering to extract specific features/topics and the associated sentiment.

description:
Skilled working on Linked Data, Machine Learning, building large scale spark pipelines with industrial and academic experience. Experienced working on Linked Data / Data Science domain for the Financial and Pharmaceutical industry. 

I currently work at Jefferies, building and maintaining a Knowledge Graph for the bankers to achieve their business goals. 

I graduated from University of Southern California with a Masters in Applied Data Science. My interests range from Machine Learning, Natural Language Processing, and creating a Knowledge Base through Information Retrieval, Entity Resolution and Ontology Mapping. I am interested in working towards making data linked and accessible using Knowledge Graphs. 

Previously, I have worked as a Research Assistant at USC Information Sciences Institute at the Center on Knowledge Graphs where I worked on building an entity linking system that links tables to a Knowledge Base. I also have worked on building a linked data source on Drugs using RxNorm, Wikidata, etc. Previously, I have also worked as a Data Science intern at Novartis working towards FAIRification of Biomedical data using Knowledge Graphs. 

Webpage: http://rijulvohra.github.io/rijulvohra/
Source Code for some my very interesting work can be found at: https://github.com/rijulvohra

Skills

Languages and Databases: Python, C++, SQL, MATLAB, Firebase, MongoDB, MySQL, RDF, Blazegraph, Neo4j, SPARQL
Data Science Skills: Supervised Learning, Unsupervised Learning, Natural Language Processing, Embeddings, Seq2Seq models, Knowledge Graphs, Linked Data, Semantic Web
Significance Testing: Hypothesis Testing, A/B Testing

Leadership – exhibits confidence in self and others; inspires and motivates others to perform well; effectively influences actions and opinions of others. Accepts feedback from others.

Problem Solving – identifies and resolves problems in a timely manner; gathers and analyses information skillfully; develops alternative solutions; works well in group problem solving situations; uses reason even when dealing with emotional topics.

Communication – expresses ideas and thoughts verbally; expresses ideas and thoughts in written form; exhibits good listening and comprehension; keeps others informed
